metadata.title: CVE-2019-13566 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the ROS communications-related packages (akaros_comm or ros-melodic-ros-comm) through 1.14.3. A buffer overflow allowsattackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary codevia an IP address with a long hostname.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cl-roscpp-msg - 1.14.3+ds1-10
cl-topic-tools - 1.14.3+ds1-10
libmessage-filters1d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
librosbag-storage4d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
librosbag4d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
libroscpp3d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
libroslz4-1d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
libtopic-tools2d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
libxmlrpcpp3d - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-message-filters - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosbag - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-roscpp-msg - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosgraph - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-roslaunch - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-roslz4 - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosmaster - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosmsg - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosnode - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosparam - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rospy - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rosservice - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rostest - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-rostopic - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-roswtf - 1.14.3+ds1-10
python3-topic-tools - 1.14.3+ds1-10
ros-roscpp-msg - 1.14.3+ds1-10
ros-topic-tools-srvs - 1.14.3+ds1-10
rosout - 1.14.3+ds1-10
topic-tools - 1.14.3+ds1-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ros-ros-comm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.14.3+ds1-10').
